conversation_content.text_content: Namaste! I am Abida Nazir  from JioMart, how may I assist you today?
The last order i received is stale
It is understandable that you are very upset about what has happened. Please be rest assured, we always strive to create a positive customer experience.
As you have informed us that your concern is about that you had received a bad quality order
Can you please help us with the last 4 digits of your shipment id to check the further details?
Are you able to see my last order?
Just to confirm, Is this the same shipment is  17561172200380553A-01 that you are enquiring about?
Yes I cannot check but this should be my last order
Avocado Hass Each (Approx. 150 g - 180 g) both two quantities are stale
Please share complete images of product of two quantities both
Both the image are for individual items
I have already shared the images

We regret the inconvenience caused to you. We are raising a refund request against  product Avocado Hass    and  the request number is          756181282595  .  We will credit the refund amount of Rs 158  in  your Jiomart Wallet by  EOD of 28-August-2025
Is it possible to refund it in original payment method?
If not that is also ok but please confirm if it's possible or not
Sorry to interrupt, just to make sure, are we still connected?
I have not heard from you for a while, I will remain available for another 30 Secs if you need further assistance.
And you are saying you are not receiving a response
Since there was no response from your end, we have to close the session. If you need any further assistance, kindly get back to us between 08:00 AM to 08:00 PM, we will be happy to assist you.

auto_qa_result.category: Is the opening and closing correct?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
You are an AI Quality Auditor for CHAT TICKETS ONLY. Analyze transcript (timestamps) for Script Adherence Score {0, 2, 4}. Output ONLY: Score: X | Justification: [1-2 sentences]. Always score (no NA). Human emotion: Full for enthusiastic/empathetic (checks, positive close); partial for hesitant; zero for abrupt.

The system field !!!initial_greeting_time!!!  indicates whether the agent’s first reply in the conversation was sent within 30 seconds of the customer starting the conversation:

!!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = true → opening given within 30 seconds (on time).

!!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = false → opening not given within 30 seconds (use timestamps for further classification if needed).

Scoring Rules (Strict Hierarchy; First Match Wins)
Handover Silence Immunity: If the customer is absent during agent entry (no customer message after agent joins), ignore any perceived opening delay; proactive connection checks and correct closing are treated as full adherence.

Closing Logic (Critical):

Customer silent/no reply:
The line
Since there was no response from your end, we have to close the session. If you need any further assistance, kindly get back to us between 08:00 AM to 08:00 PM, we will be happy to assist you.
must be treated as the correct CSAT/closing line and counted as a valid closing for full score.

Customer replies and is satisfied:
The line
Thank you for contacting JioMart. Have a great day ahead.
must be treated as the correct CSAT/closing line and counted as a valid closing for full score.

Any other closing pattern may reduce the score (partial or zero), depending on clarity and professionalism.

Score 4 (Full)
Assign Score = 4 if ALL of the following are true:

Opening:

!!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = true (opening given within 30 seconds of conversation start), and

The opening script is clear and complete, explicitly includes “Namaste”, brand name, and associate name, with an enthusiastic/confident tone.

Closing:

A clear, professional, confident closing is present, and

For no-reply scenarios, the exact SOP closing line above is used, or

For satisfied-customer scenarios, the exact “Thank you for contacting JioMart. Have a great day ahead.” line is used.

C-SAT:

CSAT/closing is pitched/used wherever applicable (inquiry or complaint resolution cases, based on context).

Further assistance:

Further assistance is offered wherever applicable (inquiries and complaint resolutions), and

Further assistance is not used for SR follow-ups or pure complaint calls where it is not required.

Holds:

First hold is refreshed within 30 seconds (or as per your hold-timing rules), with permission sought and acknowledged.

Subsequent holds are refreshed within the allowed time, with thanks on return and empathetic handling throughout.

Score 2 (Partial)
Assign Score = 2 if ANY ONE of the following issues is present, and no Score 0 condition applies:

Opening:

!!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = false and timestamps show the opening was between 31–45 seconds from conversation start, or

The opening is dull/unclear or missing “Namaste”/key elements, even if !!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = true.

Holds (minor issues):

Permission was taken, but the advisor did not acknowledge when the customer granted hold permission, or

The advisor did not thank the customer after returning from hold, while other hold timing rules are still respected.

Closing / CSAT:

A closing is present but not fully confident/clear, or

CSAT/closing was not pitched where applicable, even though the rest of the script is acceptable.

Tone is polite but somewhat mechanical or hesitant.

Score 0 (Failure)
Assign Score = 0 if ANY ONE of the following critical violations is observed:

Opening:

No opening script at all, or

!!!initial_greeting_time!!!  = false and timestamps show the opening was delayed more than 45 seconds from conversation start, with no valid justification, or

The overall tone is abrupt/negative.

Holds (major issues):

Hold not refreshed within required time (first 30 seconds, then 60 seconds, etc.), or

The advisor put the customer on hold without taking permission.

Further assistance / Closing:

Further assistance is not offered where it is clearly applicable (e.g., inquiry/complaint resolution), or

Closing/CSAT is clearly inappropriate or missing in a context where it is required, and the interaction ends abruptly or confusingly.

auto_qa_result.category: Did the associate comprehend the customer's problem and respond appropriately?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
You are an AI Quality Auditor for CHAT TICKETS ONLY. Analyze transcript for VOC Comprehension Score {0, 7.5, 15}. Output ONLY: Score: X | Justification: [1 sentence]. Always score (no NaN).

Score hierarchically (first match; JioMart SOP: full VOC → apology + complaint # + 3-5 TAT ):

15 (Full): ALL perfect:

Full VOC read, no skips/conclusions.

Precise understanding, original/modified response (NO restating/paraphrasing VOC).

Exact SOP, complete/nuanced resolution (e.g., addresses delays explicitly) confidently/clearly.

No repeats, no customer re-query, no hesitation.

7.5 (Partial/Incomplete): Understood issue but ANY:

VOC restatement/repetition/paraphrasing.

Incomplete info/nuance (e.g., TAT echoed without delay resolution).

Hesitation/confusion in articulation.

Partial SOP/response (customer impact low-moderate).

Made customer repeat or minor misarticulation.

0 (Failure): ANY severe:

Skipped/misunderstood VOC.

Wrong conclusion/template/SOP → incorrect resolution.

Examples:

15: Debit VOC → direct SOP/complaint # + TAT + delay handled, no restate.

7.5: Debit grasped + complaint #/TAT, but restated 'money debited' or ignored week delay.

0: Debit → irrelevant SOP.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent acknowledged the customer's issue regarding stale products and provided a refund request, demonstrating a clear understanding of the customer's problem. The agent also communicated the refund process clearly, which aligns with the SOP.

auto_qa_result.category: Is correct and complete information shared?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
You are an AI Quality Auditor for CHAT TICKETS ONLY. Analyze transcript + metadata for Info Accuracy Score {0, 10}. Output ONLY: Score: X | Justification: [1 sentence]. Always score (no NA).
Binary Rules (fatal = 0; ignore greetings/name/empathy/hours):
Metadata: {Vertical} {product name} {Expected Delivery Date} {Payment Mode} {sellingprice} {Order ID} {Can Cancel} {Can Return} {Status} {Shipment Id} EXACT match.
SOP: TAT/refund/complaint/images correct (e.g., stale → refund # + wallet TAT; address payment queries explicitly ).
VOC: ALL fully addressed accurately—no misses/unresolved impacting expectation/resolution.
10 (Full/High): ALL metadata/SOP/VOC perfect—complete, no gaps/misinfo.
0 (Fail/Fatal): ANY:
Metadata mismatch.
SOP error (wrong TAT/process).
VOC unaddressed/misaddressed (e.g., refund mode ignored).
Misleading/incomplete info → harm/confusion.
Steps:
Extract agent's case facts/VOC responses.
Verify metadata/SOP exactness.
Confirm ALL VOC resolved → 10; ANY fail → 0.
Examples:
10: Stale VOC + exact ID/refund #/TAT + payment query answered fully.
0: Refund details correct but payment VOC unaddressed.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent provided accurate information regarding the refund request for the stale product, including the request number and the expected credit date, which aligns with the customer's inquiry about the refund process.

auto_qa_result.category: Is the complaint categorization and documentation correct?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate selected the correct complaint category and documented all required information. The assessment must verify if the advisor chose the correct vertical, sub-sub type, order identifiers, and article quantity, routed the complaint to the correct resolver team, and captured all remarks accurately, including the customer's specific Voice of Customer (VOC).
Task
The advisor must ensure that complaint tagging and documentation strictly follow the SOP requirements. All selections must match system metadata and the complaint must be routed appropriately. The relevant metadata fields to be validated are:
{Vertical}  {product name} {orderId} {Shipment Id} {qty} {VoC} 
The advisor must also correct any incorrect complaint raised earlier by another advisor, SHT, or BOT. They must record complete and precise mandatory remarks that incorporate the exact  {VoC}  to ensure the resolver team understands and can resolve the issue effectively.
Rules
Score = High (10 marks)
Assign a full score if the advisor selects the correct complaint type, vertical, sub-sub type, order ID, shipment ID, and article quantity exactly as per the metadata. All remarks must include:
Mandatory SOP remarks.
The exact information provided in the  {VoC}  field, documented clearly in the ticket Notes/backend or chat.
Accurate complaint routing.
Identification and correction of any previously incorrect complaints.
Note: For inquiry calls, assign 10/'Yes' by default.
Score = Fail (0 marks)
Assign a score of 0 if any component is incorrect or incomplete. This includes:
Incorrect category/vertical/identifiers/quantity.
Wrong routing.
Missing or inaccurate mandatory remarks.
Failure to include the specific {VoC} in the remarks.
Failure to correct previous errors from SHT/BOT/Advisors.
Any SOP deviation is a FATAL error.
Steps
Review full ticket data: Compare the advisor's actions against the metadata fields: {Vertical}  {product name} {orderId} {Shipment Id} {qty} {VoC} .
Verify Tagging: Check if the advisor selected every field (Vertical, Sub-sub type, etc.) correctly per metadata.
Validate Remarks & VOC: Ensure mandatory remarks are present and specifically check if the content of the {VoC} field was captured accurately in the notes for the resolver.
Confirm Routing: Verify the ticket was sent to the correct resolver team.
Check History: If a previous complaint was mentioned, verify the advisor corrected any existing errors.
Assign Final Score: Perfect documentation, routing, and VOC capture → 10; ANY failure or omission → 0. (Inquiries → 10).
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent correctly identified the customer's complaint about a stale order and documented the refund request with the correct product details and request number. However, there is no evidence of capturing the specific Voice of Customer (VoC) in the remarks, which is a critical requirement.

auto_qa_result.category: Is the inquiry categorization and documentation correct?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate correctly categorized and documented an inquiry interaction. The focus is on verifying if the advisor selected the correct vertical, sub-sub type, order details, and article quantity, while capturing the interaction with specific, complete remarks that reflect the actual Voice of the Customer (VOC) and the resolution provided.
Task
The advisor must ensure that inquiry tagging and documentation are 100% accurate and aligned with system metadata. All selections must match the following metadata fields:
{Vertical} {product name} {orderId} {Shipment Id} {qty} {VoC} 
The advisor must clearly document:
The exact VOC: This must match the essence of the {VoC}  field provided in the metadata.
The exact Resolution given: This must be specific. Generic remarks such as “Information shared,” “Query resolved,” or “Call disconnected” are strictly prohibited. The advisor must explicitly detail what was communicated (e.g., “Provided the customer with the tracking number and confirmed the shipment is in transit”).
Rules
Score = High (15 marks)
Assign Score = 15 if:
The advisor selected the correct vertical, sub-sub type, order ID, shipment ID, and article quantity as per the metadata.
The documentation includes a clear, non-generic description of the {VoC} and the specific resolution provided.
In the case of Complaint-only calls, this parameter is marked 'Yes' (15 marks) by default.
In cases where both an Inquiry and a Complaint are present: if both are tagged and documented correctly, mark 'Yes'.
Score = Low (0 marks)
Assign Score = 0 if any of the following occur (This triggers a 35-mark deduction from the total score):
Any mismatch between advisor selections and metadata: {Vertical}, {Order ID}, {Shipment Id}, {qty}, or {VoC}.
The advisor fails to capture the VOC or the resolution in the remarks.
The remarks are generic: Using phrases like 'Information shared' without specifying what information was shared.
In cases where both an Inquiry and a Complaint are present: if the inquiry portion is tagged or documented incorrectly, this specific parameter must be marked 0.
Steps
Identify Call Type: Determine if the interaction is a Complaint, an Inquiry, or both.
If Complaint-only → Auto-assign 15 marks.
Verify Metadata: For Inquiries, cross-verify the advisor’s tagging against: {Vertical} {product name} {orderId} {Shipment Id} {qty} {VoC} 
Validate VOC: Compare the advisor's remarks against the {VoC}  metadata field. Ensure the advisor captured the customer's actual concern specifically.
Evaluate Resolution: Check the remarks for specificity. If the advisor wrote 'Information shared,' check if they followed it with the specific details provided to the customer.
Final Scoring:
If all fields match metadata AND remarks are specific/complete → 15 marks.
If there is ANY mismatch, missing info, or generic language → 0 marks (Note: This results in a -35 penalty on the overall sheet).
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent documented the customer's complaint about receiving stale products and provided a specific resolution by raising a refund request with a request number. However, the agent did not clearly document the exact VOC or the details of the resolution in a non-generic manner, which is required for a high score.

auto_qa_result.category: Has the advisor responded in a timely manner?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate maintained timely responses during a chat interaction and did not leave the customer waiting for an unacceptable duration without communication.

Task
The advisor must not leave the customer unattended for 2 minutes or longer at any point during the chat.
In chat scenarios, this includes both delayed responses and dead gaps where the advisor does not send any message while the customer is waiting.

For chat tickets, we treat response gaps and communication silence as equivalent to hold time in voice calls. Use the pre-calculated system field !!!whole_conversation_delay!!!  (true = all gaps 120s, false = any gap =120s).

Rules
Score = High (5 marks)
If !!!whole_conversation_delay!!!  = true → Assign Score = 5 (no gaps =120s, no dead silence, chat active).

Score = Low (0 marks)
Else (!!!whole_conversation_delay!!!  = false) → Assign Score = 0 (gap =120s or dead silence observed; fatal).

Steps

Locate !!!whole_conversation_delay!!!  value.

If true → Score = 5 (all conditions met).

Else → Score = 0 (violation exists).
Always score (no NA).
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent did not leave the customer unattended for 2 minutes or longer, as the longest gap was between messages was less than 2 minutes. The agent responded promptly to the customer's queries throughout the conversation.

auto_qa_result.category: Is the action taken on ticket correct?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate took the correct action on the ticket during a chat interaction. This includes checking if they created, merged, reopened, or closed tickets correctly based on the customer’s issue or inquiry.

Task
The advisor must manage tickets correctly without duplication, wrong action, or wrong status handling.

For this check, follow these SOP rules (embedded below):

Do not create multiple tickets for the same issue or inquiry.

If duplicate tickets already exist for the same issue, they must be merged.

A ticket must be reopened if the customer raises a valid follow-up related to the same issue.

Do NOT raise a complaint ticket if only an inquiry is sufficient.

Inquiry tickets must be closed once the information is shared.

Complaint tickets must remain open until the issue is fully resolved or transferred to the correct resolver.

Filing a complaint unnecessarily (when information sharing was enough) is considered wrong action.

Closing a complaint ticket before proper resolution is considered wrong action.

Incorrect sub-subcategory selection alone does not affect this parameter.

Rules
Score = High (10 marks)

Assign Score = 10 if all the following conditions are met:

Only one ticket exists for the same issue/inquiry (unless a genuine new issue arises).

If multiple tickets existed earlier, the advisor merged them correctly.

If the customer came back with the same issue, the advisor reopened the existing ticket instead of creating a new one.

An inquiry ticket is closed after providing the required information.

A complaint ticket remains open if the issue still requires resolution.

A complaint ticket is created only when the issue cannot be solved by information sharing alone and requires backend or resolver action.

The advisor’s ticket action prevents duplication, delay, or operational confusion.

Score = Low (0 marks)

Assign Score = 0 if any one of the following is observed:

The advisor created multiple tickets for the same issue unnecessarily.

The advisor failed to merge duplicate tickets when needed.

The advisor opened a new ticket instead of reopening an existing one for the same issue.

The advisor raised a complaint ticket when the case only required information sharing.

The advisor closed a complaint ticket even though the issue was not yet resolved.

The advisor kept an inquiry ticket open unnecessarily after resolution was already provided.

The advisor failed to correct previous ticket mistakes (duplicate / wrong action).

Any of the above situations is considered FATAL for this parameter.

Steps

Review the full ticket and conversation timeline.

Identify how many tickets exist for the same issue or inquiry.

Check if any duplication was corrected through merging.

Check whether the ticket was correctly reopened, closed, or kept open based on the scenario.

Validate whether a complaint was actually necessary or if inquiry handling was enough.

If any SOP rule from the Task section is violated → Score = 0.

If all actions follow the embedded SOP → Score = 10.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent raised a refund request for the stale product and provided a request number, which indicates correct action on the ticket. However, the agent did not clarify the refund method when the customer inquired about it, which could lead to confusion. The agent's actions align with the SOP rules for managing the ticket, as they did not create multiple tickets and addressed the customer's issue appropriately.

auto_qa_result.category: Has the advisor taken responsibility for the customer's issue and shared all additional information?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the advisor demonstrated ownership, responsibility, empathy, clarity, and proactive assistance during the chat while handling an SOP 3–related issue (Order ID / Item Not Visible in Kapture).
This parameter evaluates behaviour, engagement quality, and the advisor’s ability to guide the customer with all necessary information.
This parameter is not SOP-flow-based, but the advisor’s behaviour must support the correct SOP 3 outcome. Handover silence (customer absent during agent entry) is NOT agent's fault—proactive connection checks show excellent ownership.

Task
The advisor must:

Take full responsibility for resolving the customer’s concern.

Provide all additional information needed for clarity.

Inform the customer proactively about the next steps.

Offer alternatives when required.

Escalate when necessary (e.g., CES escalation for Case 1 & Case 2).

Communicate clearly and empathetically.

Ensure the customer feels supported throughout the chat.

Closing Logic (Critical - Use Exactly):

If customer silent/no reply (e.g., handover silence): Correct = “Since there was no response from your end, we have to close the session. If you need any further assistance, kindly get back to us between 08:00 AM to 08:00 PM, we will be happy to assist you.” → + ownership boost (15). Wrong close = lower.

If customer replies/satisfied: Correct = “Thank you for contacting JioMart. Have a great day ahead.” → 15. Wrong = lower.

Any behaviour showing indifference, lack of clarity, or poor ownership leads to lower scoring. Case-by-case on customer impact.

Rules

15 Marks – Excellent (Full Ownership)
Advisor takes full ownership: proactive checks on silence (e.g., handover), empathy/patience, clear next steps, correct SOP close.

Connection checks during customer silence = engagement.

Exact no-response close used → excellent.

Customer satisfied/replies + 'Thank you... great day' close → excellent.
Ex: Handover silence + checks + SOP close, no resolution needed due to absence.

10 Marks – Average
Adequate ownership but minor gaps (e.g., basic info shared but less proactive, inconsistent empathy).
Ex: Follows SOP but misses extra guidance; close mostly correct.

5 Marks – Below Average
Basic ownership but misses key responsibilities (e.g., no BOT context check, minor stall delays).
Ex: Reactive, no proactive alternatives, close partially off.

0 Marks – Serious Deficiency (FATAL)
Fails critical ownership: no info/next steps, no escalation when needed, rude/rushed/disengaged, wrong close, repeats without progress.
Ex: Abrupt end without checks/close, ignores silence, wrong close line.

Steps

Classify chat: Handover silence? (immunity + checks = proactive → 15 boost). Customer replied/satisfied?

Check behaviour: Ownership (responsibility/info/next steps), empathy/engagement, escalation/alternatives.

Verify closing: Matches no-reply ('Since no response... 08:00 AM to 08:00 PM') or satisfied ('Thank you... great day')?

Assess impact: Silence close correct + checks = 15; gaps = 10/5; fatal miss = 0.

Output: Score: X | Justification: [1 sentence].
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent acknowledged the customer's issue regarding the stale order and took responsibility by raising a refund request, providing the request number and expected timeline for the refund. However, the closing statement was inappropriate as it indicated a lack of engagement with the customer’s responses, which could lead to confusion about the resolution process.

auto_qa_result.category: Is an advisor's spoken or written communication skill proper?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate demonstrated ownership of the customer’s issue in a chat interaction and went beyond basic process-following to add value and ensure the customer clearly understood the solution and next steps.
Task
The advisor must show responsibility, engagement, and problem-solving ability while handling the customer’s request or complaint in chat.
Follow these embedded SOP rules:
The advisor must show clear ownership instead of just forwarding or passing responsibility.
The advisor must provide clear explanations until the customer understands what will happen next.
The advisor must share additional helpful information whenever possible to improve the customer experience.
The advisor must maintain engagement, empathy, and a professional tone throughout the chat conversation.
If the chat is transferred or escalated, the advisor must provide complete context (no blank transfer).
If the customer asks for escalation, the advisor must transfer the case promptly and correctly.
The advisor must escalate proactively if the situation or customer behavior clearly indicates the need.
The advisor must avoid robotic replies, rushing, or dismissive behavior.
Rules
Score = 12 Marks – Excellent Communication
Communication is clear, concise, professional, and engaging. ALL:
Acknowledgement present/confident/courteous.
Energy/enthusiasm high/active listening.
Clear/simple language/proper pauses/no interruptions.
Proactive engagement (e.g., connection checks on silence).
Grammar/punctuation perfect/natural flow. Examples match parameter or case impact high-positive.
Score = 6 Marks – Average Communication
Generally clear but occasional lapses:
Energy neutral/simple words used but not crisp.
Minor phrasing/wordy/simple errors (comprehensible).
Verbal nods/pleasantries inconsistent.
Minor clarity lapses/dead air.
Confidence/dullness/excess nods/improper words.
Lengthy/jargon/simple construction issues.
Cough/dead air minor.
Score = 0 Marks – Serious Issues
Unprofessional/problematic:
No ack/impolite/fumbling/grammar errors/sleepy/unprofessional.
Cough/sneeze crackling/not clear/punctuation/language shift.
Case-by-case on customer impact; proactive silence handling (checks) boosts to 12.
Steps
Review full transcript.
Assess ownership/explanation/value-add/tone/escalation.
Map to tiers (excellent = proactive/full engagement → 12).
Ownership partial → 6; missing/fatal → 0.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent acknowledged the customer's issue and expressed understanding of their frustration. They provided a clear resolution by raising a refund request and communicated the next steps effectively. However, the agent's response about not receiving a reply from the customer was dismissive, which affected the overall engagement.

auto_qa_result.category: Is the advisor probing irrelevant questions or failing to ask relevant ones?

category_score_evaluation.legend:
Situation
You are evaluating whether the associate asked only relevant and necessary questions related to the customer’s VOC during a chat interaction, without over-probing or asking for system-available information.

Task
The advisor must ask only for information that is directly required to resolve the customer’s VOC.

Follow these embedded SOP rules:

The advisor must not ask for information that is irrelevant to the customer’s issue.

The advisor must not ask for details that are already available in system records (order ID, shipment ID, delivery status, etc.).

The advisor must not probe unnecessarily or ask repetitive/duplicate questions.

When probing is required, the advisor must ensure it is precise, relevant, and sufficient to resolve the issue.

The probing should help move the resolution forward — not delay or complicate it.

Rules
Score = High (9 marks)

Assign Score = 9 if all the following conditions are met:

The advisor asked only relevant questions linked directly to the customer's VOC.

No unnecessary or irrelevant information was requested.

The advisor did not ask for data already available in system records.

The questions were clear, structured, and helped speed up the resolution.

The probing was sufficient and accurate enough to progress or resolve the issue.

Score = Medium (4.5 marks)

Assign Score = 4.5 if any one of the following is observed:

The advisor asked 1–2 unnecessary or slightly irrelevant questions, but they did not confuse or frustrate the customer.

The advisor probed correctly for most information but included some avoidable or redundant questions.

The probing was generally acceptable but could have been more focused or precise.

The issue was still resolved, but the probing caused minor inefficiency.

Score = Low (0 marks)

Assign Score = 0 if any one of the following is observed:

The advisor asked multiple irrelevant questions not related to the customer’s issue.

The advisor asked for information that was clearly available in system records.

The advisor over-probed, delayed resolution, or caused customer irritation.

The probing was poorly structured, unnecessary, or obstructed the conversation.

Any such instance is considered fatal for this parameter.

Steps

Identify the customer’s VOC from the conversation.

Review every question asked by the advisor.

Check if each question was directly relevant to resolving that VOC.

Check if any question asked could have been answered from system data instead.

If most probing is relevant and correctly done → Score = 9.

If probing has minor inefficiencies → Score = 4.5.

If probing is largely unnecessary or irrelevant → Score = 0.
category_score_evaluation.evaluation_reason: The agent asked for the last 4 digits of the shipment ID and the order date, which are necessary to address the customer's concern about the stale order. However, the request for the shipment ID could be seen as redundant since the customer had already provided it later in the conversation. Overall, the probing was relevant but included some unnecessary repetition.

QA_Ticket_Details.VoC: The customer is complaining for F&V product issues- 1) Name of the product that has issues:Avocado Hass 2) Issue with the product: Defective

auto_qa_result_summary: The agent demonstrated strengths in timely responses and correct actions on customer tickets, effectively addressing the customer's issue regarding stale products and raising a refund request. However, critical areas for improvement were identified, particularly in the accurate sharing of complete information and proper documentation of complaints and inquiries. The agent failed to capture the specific Voice of Customer (VoC) in the remarks, which is essential for effective resolution. Additionally, the closing statement lacked engagement, potentially leading to customer confusion. Overall, while the agent showed competence in some areas, significant gaps in documentation and communication skills need to be addressed to enhance customer satisfaction.
ticket_conversation:
agent (2025-08-26 09:38:17): Namaste! I am Abida Nazir from JioMart, how may I assist you today?  
customer (2025-08-26 09:38:34): The last order i received is stale  
agent (2025-08-26 09:39:01): It is understandable that you are very upset about what has happened. Please be rest assured, we always strive to create a positive customer experience.  
customer (2025-08-26 09:39:15): Image Received  
customer (2025-08-26 09:39:19): Image Received  
customer (2025-08-26 09:39:31): Here are the pictures  
agent (2025-08-26 09:39:35): As you have informed us that your concern is about that you had received a bad quality order  
customer (2025-08-26 09:39:44): Yes  
agent (2025-08-26 09:40:48): Can you please help us with the last 4 digits of your shipment id to check the further details?  
customer (2025-08-26 09:41:18): How do I get that?  
customer (2025-08-26 09:41:48): Are you able to see my last order?  
agent (2025-08-26 09:43:09): Please confirm order date  
customer (2025-08-26 09:43:20): August 25  
agent (2025-08-26 09:44:10): Just to confirm, Is this the same shipment is 17561172200380553A-01 that you are enquiring about?  
customer (2025-08-26 09:44:30): Yes I cannot check but this should be my last order  
customer (2025-08-26 09:45:09): Id is  
customer (2025-08-26 09:45:13): 17561172200380553A-01  
agent (2025-08-26 09:46:21): Thankyou  
customer (2025-08-26 09:46:28): Sure  
agent (2025-08-26 09:46:48): Avocado Hass Each (Approx. 150 g - 180 g) both two quantities are stale
